Title: California Genocide
Description: A series of systematized killings and atrocities committed against Indigenous peoples of California by United States government agents and private citizens in the 19th century.
Government_Actions: Favored white settlers' rights over Indigenous rights, dispossessing natives.
Academic_And_Activist_Recognition: Several American academics and activist organizations have characterized the period following the U.S. Conquest of California as genocide against Native Americans.

Official_Apology.Action: Apologized for the genocide and called for a research group to be formed to understand the topic better.
